user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of deinit_data:
```c
static void
deinit_data (void)
{
  if (NULL != resp_single)
    MHD_destroy_response (resp_single);
  resp_single = NULL;
  if (NULL != resps)
  {
    unsigned int i;
    for (i = 0; i < num_resps; ++i)
      MHD_destroy_response (resps[i]);
    num_resps = 0;
    free (resps);
  }
  resps = NULL;
  if (NULL != body_dyn)
    free (body_dyn);
  body_dyn = NULL;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
free (resps);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not violated in the shown code: free(resps) is inside the conditional if (NULL != resps) and will execute whenever resps is non-NULL, so it is reachable. A concrete violation scenario would be if resps were provably always NULL at this point (for example, resps is initialized to NULL and never assigned a non-NULL value before this function is called, or resps is unconditionally set to NULL immediately prior to the if). In that case the entire if-body (including free(resps)) would be unreachable and would violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1.
